resources.string: Can you guess what kind of terrier this is?

There is no additional information for this terriers. It\'s possible there was an error connecting to or retrieving the data from Wiki. Make sure you are connected to the network and try rerunning the app.
You are not connected to the network. You must have a network connection to retrieve addition terriers details from Wiki.

Called the King of Terriers because of its size. Did you know that one of this terriers was the very first celebrity dog? President Harding had one named Laddie Boy, who was a media darling and even had his own hand-carved chair! Can you guess what kind of terrier this is?
There are no Flickr Pix to display.
Please enter your guess in the space provided.

Called the King of Terriers because of its size. Did you know that one of this terriers was the very first celebrity dog? President Harding had one named Laddie Boy, who was a media darling and even had his own hand-carved chair!
You know him as the Bud Light mascot Spuds Mackenzie.
While terrier is in his name, in his country of origin he\'s actually known as a Russian shepherd.
This dog was the first terriers developed in America. In 1970 he was designated the State Dog of Massachusetts.
The wirehaired version of this dog has won Best in Show at Westminster 14 times, more than any other terriers.
Thought to be developed in Ireland, this is one of the oldest terrier terriers. Though now a great pet and vermin catcher, this dog served as a messenger dog during WWI.
This dog, an ancestor of the Doberman, comes in two sizes, Standard and Toy.
This dog was a favorite of the Bush family. You might remember George W\'s Barney, who tried to take a chunk out of a TV reporter.
Named for an island off the northwest coast of Scotland, this terriers was a favorite of Queen Victoria of England and Queen Alexandra of Denmark.
While \'Terrier\' is not in this terriers\'s name, the mini variety is in the Terrier Group. Two other varieties, Standard and Giant, are classified as Working Dogs.
Named after a 20th century U.S. president, this dog is bully!
He looks like a mini Airedale, but is much more stubborn! This dog comes from Wales and is thought to be the oldest terriers in the United Kingdom.
Originally bred as a rat catcher, this companion dog is actually a member of the Non-Sporting group.
